00040 #ifndef _world_cpp

00042 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00043 //The world that integrates everything
00044 //
00045 //This is where all the calls to the the underlying libraries should be from.
00046 //World is an abstraction layer to all of the non-ui libraries. The ui
00047 //layers wx and ogre both have their own main loops, so it is almost mandatory
00048 //for other code to interact with those libraries directly.
00049 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

00090     World::World()
00091     {
00092         Vector3 Lbounds(-1000.0,-1000.0,-1000.0);
00093         Vector3 Ubounds(1000.0,1000.0,1000.0);
00094         std::vector <ManagerBase*> temp;
00095 
00096         this->Construct(Lbounds, Ubounds, 10, "SceneManager", SceneManager::Generic, "Physgame.log", temp);
00097     }

00100                     const Vector3 &GeographyUpperbounds_,
00101                     std::string SceneManagerName,
00102                     SceneManager::SceneManagerType SceneType,
00103                     const unsigned short int  &MaxPhysicsProxies_,
00104                     std::string LogFileName)
00105     {
00106         std::vector <ManagerBase*> temp;
00107         this->Construct(GeographyLowerBounds_,
00108                         GeographyUpperbounds_,
00109                         MaxPhysicsProxies_,
00110                         SceneManagerName,
00111                         SceneType,
00112                         LogFileName,
00113                         temp );
00114     }

00120             SceneManager::SceneManagerType SceneType,

00125                         GeographyUpperbounds_,

00139 
00140     void World::Construct(  const Vector3 &GeographyLowerBounds_,
00141                                 const Vector3 &GeographyUpperbounds_,
00142                                 const unsigned short int &MaxPhysicsProxies_,
00143                                 std::string SceneManagerName,
00144                                 SceneManager::SceneManagerType SceneType,
00145                                 std::string LogFileName,
00146                                 std::vector <ManagerBase*> ManagerToBeAdded)
00147     {
00148         //Set some sane Defaults for some values
00149         this->SetWindowName("AppName");
00150         this->TargetFrameLength=16;
00151         this->HasSDLBeenInitialized=false;
00152         this->FrameTime = 0;
00153         this->OgreRoot = new Ogre::Root(crossplatform::GetPluginsDotCFG(),crossplatform::GetSettingsDotCFG(),"Physgame.log");
00154 
00155         assert(0==World::TheRealWorld);
00156         World::TheRealWorld = this;
00157 
00158         //add each manager that was passed in to the manager list
00159         for(std::vector<ManagerBase*>::iterator iter = ManagerToBeAdded.begin(); iter!= ManagerToBeAdded.end(); iter++)
00160             { this->AddManager(*iter); }
00161 
00162         //Create and add any managers that have not been taken care of yet.
00163         if(this->GetActorManager()==0)
00164             { this->AddManager(new ActorContainerVector()); }
00165         if(this->GetGraphicsManager()==0)
00166             { this->AddManager(new GraphicsManager()); }
00167         if(this->GetSoundManager()==0)
00168             { this->AddManager(new SoundManager()); }
00169         if(this->GetResourceManager()==0)
00170             { this->AddManager(new ResourceManager()); }
00171         if(this->GetEventManager()==0)
00172             { this->AddManager(new EventManager()); }
00173         if(this->GetPhysicsManager()==0)
00174             { this->AddManager(new PhysicsManager(GeographyLowerBounds_,GeographyUpperbounds_,MaxPhysicsProxies_)); }
00175         if(this->GetSceneManager()==0)
00176             { this->AddManager(new SceneManager(SceneManagerName, SceneType)); }
00177         if(this->GetUIManager()==0)
00178             { this->AddManager(new UIManager()); }
00179 
00180         // This Tests various assumptions about the way the platform works, and will not act
00181         SanityChecks();
00182     }
00183 
00184     void World::SanityChecks()
00185     {
00186         crossplatform::WaitMilliseconds(1500);
00187         //Perform a Test that only needs to be done once for the SDL/Physuserinputevent system.`
00188         Log("Verifying size of userinput events:");
00189         Log(sizeof(MetaCode::InputCode));
00190         Log(sizeof(SDLKey));
00191         Log(sizeof(int));
00192         if(sizeof(MetaCode::InputCode) != sizeof(SDLKey))
00193         {
00194             LogAndThrow("User input subsystem Event Sizes  Don't match, userinput subsystem will go down faster than 'that' girl on prom night.");
00195         }else{
00196             Log("External User input subsystem Event Sizes match, the User Input subsystem won't crash instantly");
00197         }
00198 
00199         if(sizeof(MetaCode::InputCode) != sizeof(int))
00200         {
00201             LogAndThrow("Internal User input subsystem Event Sizes Don't match, userinput subsystem cannot function.");
00202         }else{
00203             Log("Internal User input subsystem Event Sizes match, the User Input subsystem won't crash instantly");
00204         }
00205     }
00206 
00207     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00208     //tears the world down
00209     World::~World()
00210     {
00211         //All the pointers Ogre made should get taken care of by OGRE
00212         delete OgreRoot;
00213 
00214         for(std::list<ManagerBase*>::iterator iter = this->ManagerList.begin(); iter!= ManagerList.end(); iter++)
00215         {
00216             this->ManagerList.erase(iter);
00217         }
00218 
00219         //remove sdl stuff
00220         SDL_FreeSurface(SDLscreen);
00221         SDL_Quit();
00222     }
00223 
00224     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00225     //appends to the gamelog which is managed by Ogre
00226     void World::LogString(const String& Message)
00227     {
00228         static std::stringstream* Audiolog = 0;
00229         if (0 == Audiolog)
00230         {
00231             Audiolog = this->GetSoundManager()->GetLogs();
00232         }else{
00233             Ogre::LogManager::getSingleton().logMessage(Audiolog->str());
00234             Audiolog->str("");
00235         }
00236 
00237         if( this->LogStream.str().size() > 0 )
00238         {
00239             Ogre::LogManager::getSingleton().logMessage(this->LogStream.str());
00240             this->LogStream.str("");
00241         }
00242 
00243         if(Message.size()>0)
00244             { Ogre::LogManager::getSingleton().logMessage(Message); }
00245 
00246     }
00247 
00248     void World::Log()
00249     {
00250         this->LogString("");
00251     }

00253     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00254     // Start the Game already
00255     void World::GameInit( const bool &CallMainLoop )
00256     {
00257         //#define PHYSDEBUG
00258         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00259         this->Log("Entering GameInit()");
00260         #endif
00261 
00262         this->LoadOgreSettings();
00263         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00264         this->Log("Loaded Graphics Settings");
00265         #endif
00266 
00267         this->CreateRenderWindow();
00268         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00269         this->Log("Created the Render Work");
00270         #endif
00271 
00272         for (std::list< ManagerBase* >::iterator Iter=this->ManagerList.begin(); Iter!=this->ManagerList.end(); ++Iter )
00273         {
00274             (*Iter)->Initialize();
00275             #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00276             this->LogStream << "Initializing " << (*Iter)->GetTypeName() << " Manager";
00277             #endif
00278         }
00279 
00280         if(CallMainLoop)
00281         {
00282             #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00283             this->Log("Starting the main loop");
00284             #endif
00285             this->MainLoop();
00286         }else{
00287             #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00288             this->Log("Not calling the main loop");
00289             #endif
00290         }
00291     }
00292 
00293     void World::MainLoop()
00294     {
00295         /// @todo create a lighting manager and put this in there
00296         //this->OgreSceneManager->setAmbientLight( Ogre::ColourValue( 1, 1, 1 ) );
00297 
00298         /*! @page mainloop1 Main Loop Structure and Flow
00299          The MainLoop is heart of most video games and simulations.
00300 
00301          @section mainloopoverview1 Main loop Overview
00302          The Main loop runs in World.MainLoop() which is called by default from @ref World.GameInit(). By default this Method also starts the render, the physics andthe input systems. It does very
00303          little on it's own. The main loop then calls the PreMainLoopItems(), DoMainLoopItems and PreMainLoopItems(), for each manager in the order of their priority from Lowest to Highest.
00304          \n Here is a listing of  default priorities for each of the managers the a world intantiates by default:
00305             -50 User Input and events
00306             -40 Actors
00307             -30 Physics
00308             -20 Camera
00309             -10 Lighting (Not yet implemented)
00310               0 Graphics
00311              10 Sound
00312              20 Resources
00313         */
00314 
00315         //As long as all the CallBacks return true the game continues
00316         bool DoNotBreak=true;
00317         while (DoNotBreak)
00318         {
00319             for (std::list< ManagerBase* >::iterator Iter=this->ManagerList.begin(); Iter!=this->ManagerList.end(); ++Iter )
00320             {
00321                 #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00322                 this->LogStream << "Current Manager: " << (*Iter)->GetTypeName() << " ";
00323                 this->Log( (*Iter)->GetPriority() );
00324                 #endif
00325 
00326                 if( !(*Iter)->PreMainLoopItems() )
00327                     { DoNotBreak=false; }
00328 
00329                 (*Iter)->DoMainLoopItems();
00330 
00331                 if( !(*Iter)->PostMainLoopItems() )
00332                     { DoNotBreak=false; }
00333 
00334                 this->DoMainLoopLogging();
00335             }
00336 
00337         }//End of main loop
00338 
00339         //Some after loop cleanup
00340         this->DestroyRenderWindow();
00341     }
00342 
00343     void  World::DoMainLoopLogging()
00344     {
00345         this->Log(this->LogStream.str());
00346         this->LogStream.str("");
00347     }

00353     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00354     //Loads the Ogre Configuration
00355     void World::LoadOgreSettings()
00356     {
00357         //Try loading from the default location
00358         if (!this->OgreRoot->restoreConfig())
00359         {
00360             //if we can't do that then lets make new settings
00361             if (!this->GetGraphicsManager()->ShowGraphicsSettingDialog())
00362             {
00363                 this->LogAndThrow("Error: Could not setup Ogre.");
00364             }
00365         }
00366     }
00367 
00368     void World::CreateRenderWindow()
00369     {
00370          //#define PHYSDEBUG
00371 
00372         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00373         this->Log("Entering CreateRenderWindow()");
00374         #endif
00375         /// @todo TODO set multithreaded SDL so it will the run event manager in another thread
00376         //Get what is needed for SDL started
00377         if (SDL_Init(SDL_INIT_VIDEO) < 0) {
00378             this->Log("Error 2: Unable to init SDL, SDL Error Follows:");
00379             this->LogAndThrow(SDL_GetError());
00380         }
00381         this->HasSDLBeenInitialized=true;
00382         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00383         this->Log("Initialized SDL");
00384         #endif
00385 
00386                 try
00387                 {
00388                         //Setup the SDL render window
00389                         this->SDLscreen = SDL_SetVideoMode( this->GetGraphicsManager()->getRenderWidth(), this->GetGraphicsManager()->getRenderHeight(),0, SDL_OPENGL);
00390                         SDL_WM_SetCaption(this->WindowName.c_str(), NULL);
00391                         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00392             this->Log("Successfully Setup SDL");
00393             #endif
00394                 }catch (exception& e) {
00395                     this->Log("Failed to Setup SDL");
00396                         LogAndThrow(e.what());
00397                 }
00398 
00399         //Start Ogre Without a native render window
00400         Ogre::RenderWindow* OgreGameWindow = NULL;
00401         try
00402         {
00403             //crossplatform::WaitMilliseconds(1000);
00404             OgreGameWindow = this->OgreRoot->initialise(false, this->WindowName);
00405             #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00406             this->Log("Setup Ogre Window");
00407             #endif
00408         }catch (exception& e) {
00409                     this->Log("Failed to Setup Ogre Window");
00410                         LogAndThrow(e.what());
00411                 }
00412 
00413         //Configure Ogre to render to the SDL window
00414         Ogre::NameValuePairList *misc;
00415         misc=(Ogre::NameValuePairList*) crossplatform::GetSDLOgreBinder();
00416         (*misc)["title"] = Ogre::String(this->WindowName);
00417         OgreGameWindow = this->OgreRoot->createRenderWindow(WindowName, this->GetGraphicsManager()->getRenderHeight(), this->GetGraphicsManager()->getRenderWidth(), this->GetGraphicsManager()->getFullscreen(), misc);
00418         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00419         this->Log("Bound Ogre to an SDL window");
00420         #endif
00421 
00422         this->GetGraphicsManager()->SetOgreWindowPointer(OgreGameWindow);
00423         //prepare a scenemanager
00424         //this->OgreSceneManager = this->OgreRoot->createSceneManager(Ogre::ST_GENERIC,"SceneManager");
00425         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00426         this->Log("Created the Ogre Scenemanager");
00427         #endif
00428 
00429         //setup a default camera unless has been setup yet
00430         Camera* camera = NULL;
00431         if(this->GetCameraManager()==0)
00432         {
00433             this->AddManager(new CameraManager (0));
00434         }
00435         camera = this->GetCameraManager()->DefaultCamera;
00436         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00437         this->Log("Created Default Camera");
00438         #endif
00439 
00440         //viewport connects camera and render window
00441         Ogre::Viewport* OgreViewport = NULL;
00442         OgreViewport = this->GetGraphicsManager()->GetOgreWindowPointer()->addViewport(camera->Cam);
00443         this->GetCameraManager()->Viewports["DefaultViewport"] = OgreViewport;
00444 
00445         //setting the aspect ratio must be done after we setup the viewport
00446         camera->Cam->setAspectRatio( Ogre::Real(OgreViewport->getActualWidth()) / Ogre::Real(OgreViewport->getActualHeight()) );
00447         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00448         this->Log("Configured Viewport and Aspect Ratio");
00449         #endif
00450     }
00451 
00452     /// @todo Possibly move this function, along with the corresponding create function to the graphics manager as well.
00453     void World::DestroyRenderWindow()
00454     {
00455         this->GetGraphicsManager()->GetOgreWindowPointer()->destroy();
00456     }

00501     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00502     // Upper Management
00503     ///////////////////////////////////////
00504     void World::AddManager(ManagerBase* ManagerToAdd)
00505     {
00506         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00507         this->LogStream << "Calling World::AddManager("<<ManagerToAdd<<") size before:" <<this->ManagerList.size();
00508         #endif
00509         if(!this->ManagerList.empty())
00510         {
00511             for(std::list< ManagerBase* >::iterator ManIter = this->ManagerList.begin(); ManIter!=this->ManagerList.end(); ++ManIter )
00512             {
00513                 if( (*ManIter)->GetPriority() > ManagerToAdd->GetPriority())
00514                 {
00515                     this->ManagerList.insert(ManIter, ManagerToAdd);
00516                     #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00517                     this->LogStream << " - Added by sorted insertion:"<<ManagerToAdd<<" - size after:" <<this->ManagerList.size() ;
00518                     #endif
00519                     return;
00520                 }
00521             }
00522         }
00523         ManagerList.push_back(ManagerToAdd);
00524         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00525         this->LogStream << " - Added by push_back:"<<ManagerToAdd<<" - size after:" <<this->ManagerList.size() << endl;
00526         #endif
00527     }
00528 
00529     void World::RemoveManager(ManagerBase* ManagerToRemove)
00530     {
00531         if(this->ManagerList.empty())
00532         {
00533             // do nothing
00534         }else{
00535             for(std::list< ManagerBase* >::iterator ManIter = this->ManagerList.begin(); ManIter!=this->ManagerList.end(); ++ManIter )
00536             {
00537                 if( *ManIter == ManagerToRemove )
00538                 {
00539                     this->ManagerList.erase(ManIter);
00540                     break;
00541                 }
00542             }
00543         }
00544     }
00545 
00546     void World::RemoveManager(const ManagerBase::ManagerTypeName &ManagersToRemoveType, short unsigned int WhichOne)
00547     {
00548         if(this->ManagerList.empty())
00549         {
00550             //do nothing
00551         }else{
00552             for(std::list< ManagerBase* >::iterator ManIter = this->ManagerList.begin(); ManIter!=this->ManagerList.end(); ++ManIter )
00553             {
00554                 if( (*ManIter)->GetType() == ManagersToRemoveType )
00555                 {
00556                     if(0==WhichOne)     // we use our copy of WhichOne as a countdown to 0
00557                     {
00558                         this->ManagerList.erase(ManIter);
00559                     }else{
00560                         --WhichOne;
00561                     }
00562                 }
00563             }
00564         }
00565     }
00566 
00567     ManagerBase* World::GetManager(const ManagerBase::ManagerTypeName &ManagersToGet, short unsigned int WhichOne)
00568     {
00569         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00570         this->LogStream << "Calling World::GetManager(Type:"<<ManagersToGet<<") searching through "<<this->ManagerList.size()<<" Items.";
00571         #endif
00572         if(this->ManagerList.empty())
00573         {
00574             return 0;
00575         }else{
00576             for(std::list< ManagerBase* >::iterator ManIter = this->ManagerList.begin(); ManIter!=this->ManagerList.end(); ++ManIter )
00577             {
00578                 if( (*ManIter)->GetType() == ManagersToGet )
00579                 {
00580                     if(0==WhichOne)     // we use our copy of WhichOne as a countdown to 0
00581                     {
00582                         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00583                         this->LogStream << " - Got:" << *ManIter <<endl;
00584                         #endif
00585                         return *ManIter;
00586                     }else{
00587                         --WhichOne;
00588                     }
00589                 }
00590             }
00591         }
00592         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00593         this->LogStream << " - Got:Nothing" << endl;
00594         #endif
00595         return 0;
00596     }
00597 
00598     void World::UpdateManagerOrder(ManagerBase* ManagerToChange, short int Priority_)
00599     {
00600         ManagerToChange->SetPriority(Priority_);
00601         if(this->ManagerList.empty())
00602         {
00603             ManagerList.push_back(ManagerToChange);
00604         }else{
00605             for(std::list< ManagerBase* >::iterator ManIter = this->ManagerList.begin(); ManIter!=this->ManagerList.end(); ++ManIter )
00606             {
00607                 if( (*ManIter)->GetPriority() > ManagerToChange->GetPriority() )
00608                 {
00609                     this->ManagerList.insert(ManIter,ManagerToChange);
00610                 }else if(*ManIter == ManagerToChange )
00611                 {
00612                     this->ManagerList.erase(ManIter);
00613                 }
00614             }
00615         }
00616     }
00617 
00618     void World::UpdateManagerOrder()
00619     {
00620         if(this->ManagerList.empty())
00621         {
00622             //do nothing
00623         }else{
00624             std::list< ManagerBase* > temp; //(this->ManagerList.begin(),this->ManagerList.end());
00625             temp.swap(this->ManagerList);
00626             for(std::list< ManagerBase* >::iterator TempIter = temp.begin(); TempIter!=temp.end(); ++TempIter )
00627             {
00628                 this->AddManager(*TempIter);
00629             }
00630         }
00631     }
00632

00671     }
